page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: {Roundbridge Farm.}On the 20th of June 1985 we went to Roundbridge Farm. First we went into the sheds to have a look at the equipment that Mr Elcock, the farmer, uses. Mr Elcock has 250 acres which he manages on his own. This is why he has so much machinery. Mr Elcock took us around the farm on a trailer pulled by a tractor. We sat on bales of hay. The fields are used to grow crops. These are oats, barley, beans, wheat and grass for hay. The bean plants had a disease called chocolate spot. All the plants had been sprayed lately for pests and weeds. Mr Elcock sells his oats for porrige. He sells the hay to a neighbouring farmer. The wheat and barley are sold to merchants and the beans are sold for cattle food. The farm is next to a golf course. We saw a lot of flowers and different grasses
